attachments.title: Quasi-newton solver for sparse jacobian
attachments.text: Hi community, I was wondering if there is a sparse-optimized quasi-newton solver in the Julia ecosystem. This question was motivated by the undocumented broyden solver in NLsolve.jl. This solver requires the inverse of the jacobian, which is clearly not optimal when it’s sparse. I wouldn’t mind implementing my own if there isn’t, but could anyone point me to the right algorithm either in math or from other languages? Thanks!
